intro: Psychotria verticillata, commonly known as the "whorled Psychotria," is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, whorled arrangement of leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. The plant contains various alkaloids, some of which have been studied for their potential pharmacological properties.
